name: v1.5.7
body:
## Initial setup (when using with Bazel < 7.1)

rules_apko requires a one-time setup to configure bazel to be able to make partial fetches.

Follow https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/blob/main/docs/initial-setup.md for the setup.

## Using Bzlmod

1. Enable with `common --enable_bzlmod` in `.bazelrc`.
2. Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_apko", version = "1.5.7")
```

## Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your  file:

```starlark
load("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")
http_archive(
    name = "rules_apko",
    sha256 = "e8a8d904f47e769e692c34b90e6d4c6cca7bb1c735ed26995b2a1ec1530a96ed",
    strip_prefix = "rules_apko-1.5.7",
    url = "https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/releases/download/v1.5.7/rules_apko-v1.5.7.tar.gz",
)

######################
# rules_apko setup #
######################
# Fetches the rules_apko dependencies.
# If you want to have a different version of some dependency,
# you should fetch it *before* calling this.
# Alternatively, you can skip calling this function, so long as you've
# already fetched all the dependencies.
load("@rules_apko//apko:repositories.bzl", "apko_register_toolchains", "rules_apko_dependencies")

rules_apko_dependencies()

apko_register_toolchains(name = "apko")

load("@rules_apko//apko:translate_lock.bzl", "translate_apko_lock")

translate_apko_lock(
    name = "example_lock",
    lock = "@//:apko.lock.json",
)

load("@example_lock//:repositories.bzl", "apko_repositories")

apko_repositories()

translate_apko_lock(
    name = "example_multifile_lock",
    lock = "@//multifile_config:apko.generated.lock.json",
)

load("@example_multifile_lock//:repositories.bzl", multifile_lock_repositories = "apko_repositories")

multifile_lock_repositories()
```


## What's Changed
* Upgrade all module dependencies by @xnox in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/153


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/compare/v1.5.6...v1.5.7

```starlark
######################

# Fetches the rules_apko dependencies.
```

## What's Changed
* switch to user repo rule by @xnox in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/150
* chore(deps): bump step-security/harden-runner from 2.12.1 to 2.12.2 by @dependabot in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/152
* bcr: add more maintainers by @xnox in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/151
* ci: add bazel 8.3.0 release to the test matrix by @xnox in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/144


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/compare/v1.5.5...v1.5.6

name: v1.5.2
body:
> [!IMPORTANT]  
> apko toolchain versions prior to v0.27.6 will no longer be supported as of 1st of June 2026

## Initial setup (when using with Bazel < 7.1)

rules_apko requires a one-time setup to configure bazel to be able to make partial fetches.

Follow https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/blob/main/docs/initial-setup.md for the setup.

## Using Bzlmod

1. Enable with `common --enable_bzlmod` in `.bazelrc`.
2. Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_apko", version = "1.5.2")
```

## Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your  file:

```starlark
load("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")
http_archive(
    name = "rules_apko",
    sha256 = "36eae086e904da6172230e4929f073ceaf73cd51c3141a0fb979183f3aac1138",
    strip_prefix = "rules_apko-1.5.2",
    url = "https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/releases/download/v1.5.2/rules_apko-v1.5.2.tar.gz",
)

######################
# rules_apko setup #
######################
# Fetches the rules_apko dependencies.
# If you want to have a different version of some dependency,
# you should fetch it *before* calling this.
# Alternatively, you can skip calling this function, so long as you've
# already fetched all the dependencies.
load("@rules_apko//apko:repositories.bzl", "apko_register_toolchains", "rules_apko_dependencies")

rules_apko_dependencies()

apko_register_toolchains(name = "apko")

load("@rules_apko//apko:translate_lock.bzl", "translate_apko_lock")

translate_apko_lock(
    name = "example_lock",
    lock = "@//:apko.lock.json",
)

load("@example_lock//:repositories.bzl", "apko_repositories")

apko_repositories()

translate_apko_lock(
    name = "example_multifile_lock",
    lock = "@//multifile_config:apko.generated.lock.json",
)

load("@example_multifile_lock//:repositories.bzl", multifile_lock_repositories = "apko_repositories")

multifile_lock_repositories()
```

## What's Changed
* Remove unsupported apko versions by @xnox in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/132


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/compare/v1.5.1...v1.5.2

name: v1.5.1
body:
> [!IMPORTANT]  
> apko toolchain versions prior to v0.27.6 will no longer be supported as of 1st of June 2026

## Initial setup (when using with Bazel < 7.1)

rules_apko requires a one-time setup to configure bazel to be able to make partial fetches.

Follow https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/blob/main/docs/initial-setup.md for the setup.

## Using Bzlmod

1. Enable with `common --enable_bzlmod` in `.bazelrc`.
2. Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_apko", version = "1.5.1")
```

## Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your  file:

```starlark
    strip_prefix = "rules_apko-1.5.1",
    url = "https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/releases/download/v1.5.1/rules_apko-v1.5.1.tar.gz",
)

######################
# rules_apko setup #
######################
# Fetches the rules_apko dependencies.
# If you want to have a different version of some dependency,
# you should fetch it *before* calling this.
# Alternatively, you can skip calling this function, so long as you've
# already fetched all the dependencies.
load("@rules_apko//apko:repositories.bzl", "apko_register_toolchains", "rules_apko_dependencies")

rules_apko_dependencies()

apko_register_toolchains(name = "apko")

load("@rules_apko//apko:translate_lock.bzl", "translate_apko_lock")

translate_apko_lock(
    name = "example_lock",
    lock = "@//:apko.lock.json",
)

load("@example_lock//:repositories.bzl", "apko_repositories")

apko_repositories()

translate_apko_lock(
    name = "example_multifile_lock",
    lock = "@//multifile_config:apko.generated.lock.json",
)

load("@example_multifile_lock//:repositories.bzl", multifile_lock_repositories = "apko_repositories")

multifile_lock_repositories()
```

## What's Changed
* release workflow permissions by @xnox in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/133


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/compare/v1.5.0...v1.5.1

name: v1.5.0
body:
> [!IMPORTANT]  
> apko toolchain versions prior to v0.27.6 will no longer be supported as of 1st of June 2026

## What's Changed
* Remove double bangs by @xnox in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/130
* Fix issue with runfile resolution in apko_run.bzl under bazel 8 by @ed-irl in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/108

## New Contributors
* @ed-irl made their first contribution in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/108

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/compare/v1.4.4...v1.5.0

name: v1.4.4
body:
## What's Changed
* Drop tests on windows and macosx, unsupported by @xnox in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/124
* Update github actions versions by @zmarano in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/126
* Upgrade to latest bazel 6 and 7 by @xnox in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/127
* upgrade again by @xnox in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/129


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/compare/v1.4.3...v1.4.4

```starlark
# you should fetch it *before* calling this.
```

```starlark
# already fetched all the dependencies.
load("@rules_apko//apko:repositories.bzl", "apko_register_toolchains", "rules_apko_dependencies")

rules_apko_dependencies()

apko_register_toolchains(name = "apko")

load("@rules_apko//apko:translate_lock.bzl", "translate_apko_lock")

translate_apko_lock(
    name = "example_lock",
    lock = "@//:apko.lock.json",
)

load("@example_lock//:repositories.bzl", "apko_repositories")

apko_repositories()

translate_apko_lock(
    name = "example_multifile_lock",
    lock = "@//multifile_config:apko.generated.lock.json",
)

load("@example_multifile_lock//:repositories.bzl", multifile_lock_repositories = "apko_repositories")

multifile_lock_repositories()
```


## What's Changed
* Stop testing on Bazel 6 by @alexeagle in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/99
* pass correct apko binary runfiles path to apko_run launcher by @Strum355 in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/53
* Add `apko show-config` bazel wrapper by @sfc-gh-mhazy in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/106
* update apko and bunch of bazel deps by @kranurag7 in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/111

## New Contributors
* @Strum355 made their first contribution in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/53
* @kranurag7 made their first contribution in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/111

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/compare/v1.4.0...v1.4.1

name: v1.4.0
body:
## Initial setup (when using with Bazel < 7.1)

rules_apko requires a one-time setup to configure bazel to be able to make partial fetches.

Follow https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/blob/main/docs/initial-setup.md for the setup.

## Using Bzlmod

1. Enable with `common --enable_bzlmod` in `.bazelrc`.
2. Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_apko", version = "1.4.0")
```

## Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your  file:

```starlark
load("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")
http_archive(
    name = "rules_apko",
    sha256 = "bb99e7040dbebdf5edd5a2a0d6078f5e2e0a4f8d57e419216c3844b9062042c1",
    strip_prefix = "rules_apko-1.4.0",
    url = "https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/releases/download/v1.4.0/rules_apko-v1.4.0.tar.gz",
)

######################
# rules_apko setup #
######################
# Fetches the rules_apko dependencies.
# If you want to have a different version of some dependency,
# you should fetch it *before* calling this.
# Alternatively, you can skip calling this function, so long as you've
# already fetched all the dependencies.
load("@rules_apko//apko:repositories.bzl", "apko_register_toolchains", "rules_apko_dependencies")

rules_apko_dependencies()

apko_register_toolchains(name = "apko")

load("@rules_apko//apko:translate_lock.bzl", "translate_apko_lock")

translate_apko_lock(
    name = "example_lock",
    lock = "@//:apko.lock.json",
)

load("@example_lock//:repositories.bzl", "apko_repositories")

apko_repositories()

translate_apko_lock(
    name = "example_multifile_lock",
    lock = "@//multifile_config:apko.generated.lock.json",
)

load("@example_multifile_lock//:repositories.bzl", multifile_lock_repositories = "apko_repositories")

multifile_lock_repositories()
```


## What's Changed
* Allow users to provide the versions of apko binaries not listed in versions.bzl by @sfc-gh-mhazy in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/78
* Fix cross repo multifile apko configs by @sfc-gh-mhazy in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/80
* fix deprecation attr, allow empty glob by @sophiephoon-canva in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/83
* Fix alpine by updating lock file by @mattmoor in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/85
* Preliminary support for `HTTP_AUTH`. by @mattmoor in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/84
* Harden GHA Workflows by @egibs in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/86
* chore(deps): update stardoc by @alexeagle in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/91
* Fix path to apko binary in apko_lock. by @sfc-gh-mhazy in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/92
* add apko 0.19.2 by @imjasonh in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/98

## New Contributors
* @mattmoor made their first contribution in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/85
* @egibs made their first contribution in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/86
* @imjasonh made their first contribution in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/98

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/compare/v1.3.0...v1.4.0

body:

## Using Bzlmod

1. Enable with `common --enable_bzlmod` in `.bazelrc`.
2. Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_apko", version = "1.3.0")
```

## Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your  file:

```starlark
load("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")
http_archive(
    name = "rules_apko",
    sha256 = "fbe12e9d578a514cbfb21bf10dc182769bceb08542ebd33d9ee560bd280ae072",
    strip_prefix = "rules_apko-1.3.0",

)

######################
# rules_apko setup #
######################
# Fetches the rules_apko dependencies.
# If you want to have a different version of some dependency,
# you should fetch it *before* calling this.
# Alternatively, you can skip calling this function, so long as you've
# already fetched all the dependencies.
load("@rules_apko//apko:repositories.bzl", "apko_register_toolchains", "rules_apko_dependencies")

rules_apko_dependencies()

apko_register_toolchains(name = "apko")

load("@rules_apko//apko:translate_lock.bzl", "translate_apko_lock")

translate_apko_lock(
    name = "example_lock",
    lock = "@//:apko.lock.json",
)

load("@example_lock//:repositories.bzl", "apko_repositories")

translate_apko_lock(
    name = "example_multifile_lock",
    lock = "@//multifile_config:apko.generated.lock.json",
)

multifile_lock_repositories()
```


## What's Changed
* Limit GITHUB_TOKEN permissions by @jedsalazar in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/54
* Make `.lock` rule work when passing `config` to `apko_image` as label to generated target. by @sfc-gh-mhazy in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/57
* Support apko configs that consist of multiple files. by @sfc-gh-mhazy in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/64
* Add apko v0.14.1 to list of apko versions by @sfc-gh-mhazy in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/66
* Update apko to v0.14.2 and refresh lockfiles by @sfc-gh-mhazy in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/67
* Set allow_empty = True in apk src globbing by @sophiephoon-canva in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/73
* Fix linux_386 platform at toolchains_repo.bzl by @farcop in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/71
* feat: use headers attribute if available by @thesayyn in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/56
* README typo: than->then by @dmivankov in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/46

## New Contributors
* @jedsalazar made their first contribution in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/54
* @sfc-gh-mhazy made their first contribution in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/57
* @sophiephoon-canva made their first contribution in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/73
* @farcop made their first contribution in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/71
* @dmivankov made their first contribution in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/46

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/compare/v1.2.3...v1.3.0

## What's Changed
* Make sure `.apko/range.sh` is created executable by apko_bazelrc macro. by @sfc-gh-ptabor in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/40
* Rename .resolve targets (deprecated) to .lock targets (consistency with apko 0.13+) by @sfc-gh-ptabor in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/47
* chore: update locks by @thesayyn in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/51

## Initial setup

rules_apko requires a one-time setup to configure bazel to be able to make partial fetches.

Follow https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/blob/main/docs/initial-setup.md for the setup.



## What's Changed
* Update CONTRIBUTING.md by @alexeagle in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/38
* Bugfix: call to rules_apko target from another repository was failing by @sfc-gh-ptabor in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/39
* Integrate with apko-0.13+ . Pass `--lockfile` to apko to get hermetic (re)builds. by @sfc-gh-ptabor in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/41


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/compare/v1.1.0...v1.2.1

## Initial setup

rules_apko requires a one-time setup to configure bazel to be able to make partial fetches.

Follow https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/blob/main/docs/initial-setup.md for the setup.



## What's Changed
* Do not depend on the alpine/edge (as resolved artifacts are dangling). by @sfc-gh-ptabor in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/33
* Enable: bazel run @rules_apko//apko resolve ./apko.yaml  by @sfc-gh-ptabor in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/36
* Enable: bazel run {path/to/apko_image_target}.resolve that regenerates resolved.json file. by @sfc-gh-ptabor in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/37
* fix: avoid double-escaping in url_escape by @plobsing in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/30

## New Contributors
* @sfc-gh-ptabor made their first contribution in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/33
* @plobsing made their first contribution in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/30

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/compare/v1.0.0...v1.1.1

Follow https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/blob/main/docs/initial-setup.md for the setup.



## What's Changed
* chore: update locks by @thesayyn in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/24
* chore: update locks by @thesayyn in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/28
* chore: update references to apko.lock.json by @alexeagle in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/27
* ci: disable windows and macos by @thesayyn in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/29


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/compare/v0.2.3...v1.0.0

name: v1.0.0-rc1
body:
## Using Bzlmod with Bazel 6

1. Enable with `common --enable_bzlmod` in `.bazelrc`.
2. Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_apko", version = "1.0.0-rc1")
```

## Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your  file:

```starlark
load("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")
http_archive(
    name = "rules_apko",
    sha256 = "5c91a2322bec84a0005dd8178495775938b581053812e70d21b030bef3625623",
    strip_prefix = "rules_apko-1.0.0-rc1",
    url = "https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/releases/download/v1.0.0-rc1/rules_apko-v1.0.0-rc1.tar.gz",
)

######################
# rules_apko setup #
######################
# Fetches the rules_apko dependencies.
# If you want to have a different version of some dependency,
# you should fetch it *before* calling this.
# Alternatively, you can skip calling this function, so long as you've
# already fetched all the dependencies.
load("@rules_apko//apko:repositories.bzl", "apko_register_toolchains", "rules_apko_dependencies")

rules_apko_dependencies()

apko_register_toolchains(name = "apko")

load("@rules_apko//apko:translate_lock.bzl", "translate_apko_lock")

translate_apko_lock(
    name = "example_lock",
    lock = "@//:apko.lock.json",
)

load("@example_lock//:repositories.bzl", "apko_repositories")

apko_repositories()
```

## Initial setup

rules_apko requires a one-time setup to configure bazel to be able to make partial fetches.

Follow https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/blob/main/docs/initial-setup.md for the setup.



## What's Changed
* chore: update locks by @thesayyn in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/24


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/compare/v0.2.3...v1.0.0-rc1

## What's Changed
* chore: update apko shas for v0.0.0 by @kawfong in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/16

body:
## Using Bzlmod with Bazel 6

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_apko", version = "0.1.1")
```

## Using WORKSPACE

```starlark
load("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")
http_archive(
    name = "rules_apko",
    sha256 = "114d1424edf7cba3f25143d6e1f3de678007e8d01d9ffd3def7fe8101f5ae023",
    strip_prefix = "rules_apko-0.1.1",

######################
# rules_apko setup #

# Fetches the rules_apko dependencies.

# Alternatively, you can skip calling this function, so long as you've

rules_apko_dependencies()

apko_register_toolchains(name = "apko")
```

## Initial setup

rules_apko requires a one-time setup to configure bazel to be able to make partial fetches.

Follow https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/blob/main/docs/initial-setup.md for the setup.



## What's Changed
* feat: implement apko rule by @thesayyn in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/1
* chore: address changes as a follow-up by @thesayyn in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/5
* feat: support oci-layout output by @thesayyn in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/6
* example: add multi arch & repo example by @thesayyn in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/8
* feat: fail if initial setup has not been performed by @thesayyn in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/9
* docs: add cache and rule docs by @thesayyn in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/10

## New Contributors
* @thesayyn made their first contribution in https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/pull/1

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/chainguard-dev/rules_apko/commits/v0.1.1

## Using WORKSPACE

```starlark
rules_apko_dependencies()

apko_register_toolchains(name = "apko")
```
